diva.gui

Class BasicFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • diva.gui.ApplicationContext
                • diva.gui.BasicFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AppContext, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class BasicFrame
extends ApplicationContext
    BasicFrame is a very simple application context that is used to display tutorial examples. It contains a menubar with a quit entry and a location for the main content pane. This kind of frame doesn't understand applications, and should therefore be used only for the simplest examples and tutorials.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    John Reekie, Nick Zamora
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
